Table of Contents

Class FileIO

Namespace
Vts.IO
Assembly
Vts.dll

This class includes methods for saving and loading JSON text and binary data It uses custom iterators for saving (unfortunately, nothing as useful for reading value types) Currently, float, double and ushort are supported (and they're processed in that order)

public static class FileIO

CopyFileFromEmbeddedResources(string, string, string)

Copy a file from embedded resources in the project assembly and copies to an external location

public static void CopyFileFromEmbeddedResources(string sourceFileName, string destinationFileName, string projectName)

Parameters

sourceFileName string

Path and filename of the file in resources

destinationFileName string

Path and filename of the destination location

projectName string

The name of the project where the file is located

CopyFileFromResources(string, string, string)

Copy a file from resources to an external location

public static void CopyFileFromResources(string sourceFileName, string destinationFileName, string projectName)

Parameters

sourceFileName string

Path and filename of the file in resources

destinationFileName string

Path and filename of the destination location

projectName string

The name of the project where the file in resources is located

Examples

FileIO.CopyFileFromResources("Resources/resourcesfile.txt", Path.Combine(resultsFolder, "resourcefile.txt"), "Vts.Desktop.Test");

CopyFolderFromEmbeddedResources(string, string, string, bool)

Copy a folder and its contents to an external location. Due to the file and folder delimiters being a dot, there are some assumptions with this method. The file extension must be only 3 characters and a file without an extension must have a name with more than 3 characters.

public static List<string> CopyFolderFromEmbeddedResources(string folderName, string destinationFolder, string projectName, bool includeFolder)

Parameters

folderName string

Name of the folder to copy

destinationFolder string

Name of the destination folder to copy the folder

projectName string

Name of the project where the file is located

includeFolder bool

Boolean value to determine whether to include the containing folder

Returns

List<string>

Returns a list of the copied files

public static void CopyStream(Stream input, Stream output)

Parameters

input Stream

Input stream to copy

output Stream

Output copied stream

Remarks

See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/230128/best-way-to-copy-between-two-stream-instances-c

WriteArrayToBinary(Array, string)

Writes an array to a binary file, as well as an accompanying .txt (JSON) file to store array dimensions

public static void WriteArrayToBinary(Array dataIN, string filename)

Parameters

dataIN Array

Array to be written

filename string

Name of the file to which the array is written

WriteArrayToBinary(Array, string, bool)

Writes an array to a binary file and optionally accompanying .xml file (to store array dimensions) if includeMetaData = true

public static void WriteArrayToBinary(Array dataIN, string filename, bool includeMetaData)

Parameters

dataIN Array

Array to be written

filename string

Name of the file where the data is written

includeMetaData bool

Boolean to determine whether to include meta data, if set to true, an accompanying XML file will be created with the same name
